website_summaries.verdict: A good all-around kick pad that balances the mobility and protection of smaller/larger options respectively.
pros: Kick pad comes with a large back handle to get a firm grip for extra safety
Pad is small enough to move around when practicing complicated techniques
Small enough to store out of the way
cons: It can be difficult to get the pad in the best position for body protection

customer_reviews.title: Buy em!!
customer_reviews.text: These pads have held up extremely well. They can take a beating for sure. I'm an amateur kickboxer & use them daily. I also train with pro mma guys so these things get used a lot. I would definitely buy them again! The price is exceptional considering that Fairtex regarded as one if the top brands out there. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a durable set of Thai pads.
customer_reviews.author: Cody G

customer_reviews.title: I love them at first and still like them but they ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these along with the fair tax 14 ounce gloves. I love them at first and still like them but they seem to be getting a little worn out after only three months of use. I use these pads about three times per week 30 minutes each time. They don't look terrible but you can see that they are starting to wear. Still a great product for the price but if your anal like me, you'd like to see a little better stitching. That being said, the straps are perfect, the handle is perfect the pads are perfect, the wait is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: peter v

customer_reviews.title: Good pads but after 2 weeks, the black is on the verge of peeling off
customer_reviews.text: I like it and all but after 4, one hour sessions of beginners Muay Thai in a span of 2 weeks, one of my pad's black covering, seems to be about to peel off. I find it a little odd since the other pad seems to be fine, and the pads at the gym of the same brand/style still seem to be in perfectly good conditions after month of punishment. Not really sure if this is normal or not, especially after only 2 weeks of usage. And I haven't even started the "real" training yet, so not sure if this will cause the pads to deteriorate quicker than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Puja R.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd set of Thai Pads from Fairtex over the last 30 years and each have received rugged use. They are extremely durable and will last many years. The only reason I got rid of my last set was because I had a home with a bunch of mold in it and decided to start fresh when I moved. Everything Fairtex makes is extremely high quality and will last many years. Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Sutton

customer_reviews.title: I've had these awesome pads for a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I've had these awesome pads for a year and a half. I use them 5 days a week so they get a lot of abuse! They have held up really well. The stitching continues to be secure and the leather just looks nicely broken in. I would highly recommend them. Update: I've had them since October, 2015 and they continue to hold up and look great. A few workout buddies have purchase them as well. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pads
customer_reviews.text: By far the best Thai pads I have used. They are nice and firm, make a crisp sound when you connect, and fit comfortably (relatively speaking, of course). I train at an MMA gym and have used various brands, but these are by far my favorite. I use these to train my wife and also to get some extra practice in with my friend who also trains. If you are debating getting these, I'd recommend committing and getting them. With Thai pads you really do get what you pay for, and these are very durable and well made. Plus they look cool, who doesn't like that?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Straps have nice padding  they are comfortable to hold .
customer_reviews.text: What I love is they dont weigh as much as a car they are comfortable to hold for a decent amount of time with the padding on the straps . They feel extremely well made have a good premium feel to them . they are a bit firm so they do have a break in period but at the same time they dont feel like a 2x4 wrapped in leather either so they wont break a prospect before they break in . With all that said I highly recommend them . Spend a little extra and pick these up if you are in the market for long lasting equipment .
customer_reviews.author: MstrJ3di

customer_reviews.title: Great Thai Pads
customer_reviews.text: My coach uses the standard pads. He told me to get the extra thick ones. The pads are heavier than I am used to but I dont feel it when I hold for people who are strong and it hard. The pads take a while to break in so you have to bear with that. Overall I would recommend the pads. My coach has had his for many years and they are still in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kakashi

customer_reviews.title: Great muay thai pads. Very good price. Holding up so far.
customer_reviews.text: These are great muay thai pads for beginner to advanced. They do have some weight to them but that's how you know they'll hold up to punishment. Been a few months and they're holding up good so far. They look great, easy to clean, and the price was reasonable. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: This is not for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Always been a Fairtex fan. The quality and structure of these pads is amazing. Easy to hold easy to adjust and a great shelf life. They will last you for a long time as long as you stay upkeeping them. The only thing I can see people disliking (especially the smaller framed people) is needing to fold over the extra leather to allow the pads a more snug fit. Some people may be annoyed with it, myself I am not especially when holding for heavyweights. If need be break them week by week and depending on the capabilities of those in your gym there should be No reason why the stiffness would be a bother after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Quijada

customer_reviews.title: But dammit if they aren't great quality and will last forever
customer_reviews.text: Jesus christ these things are hard to break in. But dammit if they aren't great quality and will last forever. Okay, maybe a few years. The pairs at my gym have been used multiple times a day, daily, for years and they're still holding up quite well. There's a reason you're looking at the Fairtex brand, you don't need reviews to tell you you should buy them. You already know you should.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hill

customer_reviews.title: My Thoughts...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these Thai Pads, they’re first stiff when you get them (obviously) and it does take a couple times of kicking and hitting it to break them in, but I’d strongly recommend these over any other Thai pads, you get what you pay for, hands down! I’ve had mine for 6 months already and they’re still doing good, just make sure you take care of them, and they will always been in good condition to use. (But that’s just my opinion)
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Iijima-Steagald

customer_reviews.title: Great quality pads.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over a month ago and waited to leave a review so as to see if this product would hold up well. This product looks brand new even after using them 3x a week for 2-3 hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: These are large size pads
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality Fairtex pads, but they are large. They are noticeably larger than the ones we use at the gym (which are red Fairtex pads). This is why I gave a 3/5 stars. We wanted normal size pads, not large. We can still use them though, and they are Fairtex, so I still gave 3/5.
customer_reviews.author: Luke H.

customer_reviews.title: Unquestionable quality.  Firm. Not curved.
customer_reviews.text: Fast - arrived 5 days after ordering. No question about the Fairtex quality. Very apparent. As other reviewers mention, they arrived very firm, so I expect a longer period of breaking in. Protection is evident, but adds a bit of weight. The only "curve " is the line where black and white leather meet on the sides -- a visual curve only. I compared many kick pads, read blogs and Amazon reviews. At their rather high price, these pads are an investment that I hope will yield benefits over years of training.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Moore

customer_reviews.title: Get’em.
customer_reviews.text: Best Thai pads you could buy. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dominican Lou

customer_reviews.title: The Best Thai pad.
customer_reviews.text: I have used all sorts of Thai pads and Fairtex are my favorite. Very easy to strap on and they take the hardest of kicks. People love striking them and I love to hold them. I bought a pair on Amazon and a pair while visiting Thailand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: Great product for serious training
customer_reviews.text: Three months of pounding and going strong. Got these for my coach so he would let me throw hard more often. They have held up and have the heft and padding for serious training.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex Fan
customer_reviews.text: Best quality fight gear you can purchase. Durable and well made to take the beatings you want it to take as you train hard. You just can’t beat Fairtex. It’s awesome that there is a marketplace for it on Amazon. Previously I would have friends bring back gear on trips to Thailand as had bad experiences ordering things that shipped from there. Being able to purchase this item and many more through Amazon sellers has been awesome!,
customer_reviews.author: BossmanKES

customer_reviews.title: Best kick pads on the market
customer_reviews.text: These really are as good as people say. I first had experience with these pads at my MMA gym. All of the Muay Thai boxers had these to train. I asked on about his and he let me know that he had his for 4 years. 4 years at 3-4 times per week and the pounding it took each day. The pads still looked great. He just cleaned it off once a week with saddle soap because people hear really sweat a lot and that one this will tear down the leather fast. The construction is excellent. A little surprised that the package was sent directly from Thailand but still pretty speedy considering.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: These pads are great. I’ve held many different types of pads and these are by far the most comfortable, most durable, and best priced. If you do serious Muay Thai training I would definitely recommend getting these.
customer_reviews.author: DWM.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat a solid reputation.
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex is considered a cornerstone in the Muay Thai world and their reputation stands up to the test for good reasons. Just like choosing training, sparring gloves you don’t want to sacrifice too much when choosing other types of protection. These Thai pads absorb some heavy kicks and knees and give the striker great feedback with the report and feel when their kick, punch is landed. There are plenty of cheaper options out there if you don’t mind knots and welts on your forearms.
customer_reviews.author: Branden Kunath

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Thai pads
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Thai pads. Better than any thing else out there. Easy to handle for the holders and conforms nicely for kicks. It does take awile to break them in. Have people that kick hard kick it as much as possible to get it softer and easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Casas

customer_reviews.title: Glowing recommendation!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pads, the leather is fantastic, the shock absorption is phenomenal and they are extremely stylish. I have a pair of the regular sized ones and the thicker pair. If I had to choose between the two i would gravitate towards the thicker pair due to the extra weight. That is just personal preference though.
customer_reviews.author: michael gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and great product. Super thick leather, a lot better to kick then a heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Alin C. Streinu

customer_reviews.title: Yes, Recomended!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. More solid than the contenders so don't expect as soft a kicking surface but good quality and easy to spray down with Tea Tree oil. The straps are very solid and designed well so they stay where you strap them. I love fairtex Gear, it's great longer lasting quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Hase

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex - expected and delivered Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice compromise if you don't want to splurge for full-on Thai Pads. They seem good quality, tough and will condition your shins. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Best pads I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had these pads when I started 15 years ago. Holding for hard kickers you have to have good pads that preserve your body, and these are about as thick as you want before sacrificing mobility. Easy to use, comfortable, and comfortable to hit, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Wang F

customer_reviews.title: Solid Quality Pads
customer_reviews.text: Solid Pads for Muay Thai or Kickboxing. They need some work breaking in, but once they are broken in they feel like like you are kicking butter plus the pad holder doesn't get as much power transferred, unlike the twins pads.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Nuge

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong ! The best
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. ! Very strong and durable. I got the standard and they are very thick. They are alot cooler looking in person than the pics on here. Also very reasonably priced I was expecting to pay alot more
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but great protection
customer_reviews.text: exactly as advertised - the only issue is one I knew about when buying them: they are significantly heavier than the KPL2 standard thickness - I noticed the weight difference for the first two weeks, but now it's nothing; on the upside when I first got them I let the hardest kickers in the school take turns kicking me for 20min to break them in and didn't feel a thing whereas the standard pads left me with bruised forearms every time. Worth the extra money in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hefford

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My old Thai pads were getting kicked flat and leaving bruises on my boy’s forearms. We ordered these new Fairtex curved extra thick Thai pads and what a difference. We love them. I highly recommended these Thai pads.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Thai pads!
customer_reviews.text: Love these Thai pads. Use these quite often for training, they can def take a beating. Hold up great. Good quality leather.
customer_reviews.author: Petey

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex Curved Muay thai Pads ( Standard )
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a pair. Quality pads! 5/5. Light and well built. Straps really keeps your hands snuged while holding for kicks and pad work. Really gives your kicks a nice snapping sound. I have nothing negative to say about these and would highly recommend to any muay thai or mma enthusiasts. Also the curve helps keep your forearms take the kick more naturally.
customer_reviews.author: A real person reviewing things

customer_reviews.title: High quality Thai pads
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality Thai pads. Extra long and super thick. You can’t go wrong with fairtex!
customer_reviews.author: Dooger53

customer_reviews.title: Great Product For Muay Thai
customer_reviews.text: I have been meaning to buy these pads and these were everything that I have been looking for. I like using it when training with a partner, it feels good punching and hitting. Great fit and well-padded from my elbow to my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray Madarang

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, the extra thick are extra thick
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, but they are stiff. They will take time to break in. Great for heavy kickers.
customer_reviews.author: Z N

customer_reviews.title: The only Mui Thai pads worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Holds up well. A little tough at first , takes a bit to break them in. You can feel how well they're made, definitely meant to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For more serious athletes. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They are a little longer than other pads. So they take a little getting used to for smaller arms. But As your skill at holding improves it gets easier and your arms build up.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Burks

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! I've already tested them out with a ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the kind of pads you would expect if you've ever trained or worked out in a muy thai gym or studio. Great quality! I've already tested them out with a trainer. They are easy to put on and take off when you are switching from hand to foot work. They adjust easily and you can tell from first use that the pads have great stitching and are made from quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Miles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Thai Pads
customer_reviews.text: As expected (I've used these at gyms I've been a member of for years) these Fairtex thai pads are incredible. The quality and function are as good as it gets. Great fit, weight balance, plenty of impact protection. You can't go wrong with these pads.
customer_reviews.author: visco28

customer_reviews.title: Love these pads
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of Fairtex anything. Love the leather and quality stitching. Pads are hard but should soften a little with time. I’m now a fan of Fairtex!
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These are great for Muay Thai! I had bought a cheap set before I made the investment for this Fairtex set. The difference is just WOW! I wish I had not wasted my $20 on the cheap set.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good. Heavy than the ones we used at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good. Heavy than the ones we used at the gym, so if youre looking for light ones, these not it mayne
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Thai pads. Got it on time. No issues. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Artur Oganisyan

customer_reviews.title: Nice pads
customer_reviews.text: Great pads, holding up well after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: youtu.be/4yZ7mabx10E

customer_reviews.title: best Thai pads out there
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in or buying these, you already know the deal. These are some of the thickest, best Thai pads out there. They protect your forearms from the mongoloids in the gym and the target on the face works well for focusing/accuracy work. The curve facilitates proper kicking technique and helps catch jabs on the top of the curve. Excellent equipment for Muay Thai or kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: EkinnE

customer_reviews.title: Super thick
customer_reviews.text: super high quality pads compared to the ones I bought from wallyworld. It was worth it to me to get the thick ones. and its real leather. and the other guy that left a comment saying he only got one pad must of had some shipping issue because I got the pair.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best pads around
customer_reviews.text: Best pads around. Stop letting your arms take the beating with bad pads. You won't regret the price you paid. Heads up, if this is your first pair of pads and you only plan to do hand work (no kicks or knees) then go for lighter, cheaper, more mobile boxing mitts.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Platt

customer_reviews.title: def a good buy
customer_reviews.text: high quality pads u get what u pay and that's what I did
customer_reviews.author: mr. smiley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pads
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best product, I train Muay Thai and feel comfortable with using these.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand
customer_reviews.text: Fairtex is the brand you can trust for this type of equipment. The price is fair and delivery is prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: ... my second pair of Fairtex pads and they never disappoint. They take an immense beating and remain some ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Fairtex pads and they never disappoint. They take an immense beating and remain some of the best quality training equipment I've ever owned. The Thai companies demonstrate the national love of Muay Thai and set themselves apart from others through their attention to detail, quality craftsmanship, and dedication to producing a durable and reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Shadrick

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, few hits can penetrate unless bigger 205ers and up hit em. Easy to clean and to adjust on your arms.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say here. Fairtex in general makes ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. Fairtex in general makes quality Muay Thai equipment. Would buy again but probably won’t have to for years!
customer_reviews.author: Louwen & Jessica Somera

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Perfect set of thai pads. Super high quality mine still look brand new after 4 mos!!
customer_reviews.author: cassiusclaynyc

customer_reviews.title: Who uses wrist straps?
customer_reviews.text: Some of you use the wrist straps and it really shows.
customer_reviews.author: Jan P.

customer_reviews.title: The best pads you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing craftsmanship is put into these pads. I’ve trained hard with these and had no issues. Also I’ve used these in my Muay Thai gym and they hold up for years. Definitely worth the money compared to the cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Marble

customer_reviews.title: Best pads, need consistent conditioning
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best you can get but you need leather conditioner or they get ruined and terrible to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Maximilian Engler

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I know Amazon has lots of cheaper alternatives to these Fairtex Muay Thai pads, but these pads are awesome. The packaging was great and very secure. The pads themselves are amazing quality and I highly suggest them.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo A.

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Best, Buy Fairtex
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing Muay Thai since @ 1989. I've held and kicked hundreds of Thai Pads. Forget the Rest, Buy the Best, Buy Fairtex! You get what you pay for, and with these you are getting quality. Fairtex is the leader in Thai Pads for a reason. They feel better than other Thai Pads and last longer. I will not buy any other brand ever again. -johnC CNY Muay Thai
customer_reviews.author: John D. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Best in muy thai
customer_reviews.text: Best ever. Always buy Fairfax. They will last for years
customer_reviews.author: Paul r Cardona

customer_reviews.title: They work perfect
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loves them. They are the perfect size and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ugh

customer_reviews.title: Great pads.
customer_reviews.text: Great pads. Really like the curve over the tradition flat pad; the curve catches kicks and punches better. Solid construction. Like the padding that is on the wrist straps. The pads absorb strikes very well and really didn't need to be broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Great pads!
customer_reviews.text: Great, high quality thai pads. Like most of their gear, Fairtex does not disappoint here and overall I think these are a good deal for the money. Should hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: amoskovi

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Investment!
customer_reviews.text: Love, LOVE these pads! High quality design, stitching, materials, etc. Highly recommended. Pricey but worth it if you regularly train.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Loved and only ever bought Fairtex for training pads. I have Twins globes that are also made in Thailand and quality was great too. Bottom line...only buy Thailand made Muay Thai products.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Bristol

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: The stitching is hard and the pad is heavy. This mitts effectively absorb the impact of a strong kick. But the size I ordered is a little big for me. And the leather on the batting face seems to peel off too early.
customer_reviews.author: kudoga

customer_reviews.title: Great product for those serious about Muay Thai
customer_reviews.text: Great product for those serious about Muay Thai, I hold pads and these are by far the best Thai pads that I own and I use these with very heavy kickers with no kicks coming through.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mansilla

customer_reviews.title: Great padding great structure
customer_reviews.text: Superb. The pads protect plenty and don’t cut up the shins. I workout with the heavyweights in my Muay Thai classes and we all feel good holding these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality & Durability
customer_reviews.text: Great set of pads once broken in. They can slide around sometimes, but I sweat quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Beisel

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality leather and it handles awesomely under pressure especially training with big 200 + pound punchers & kickers!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy E.

customer_reviews.title: Light and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Invest in these pads! Real leather will last you a long time. Satisfying sound when you punch and kick these. I hardly notice I am holding them when it is my turn to train.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McLane

customer_reviews.title: These pads are awesome! I gave them as a gift and the ...
customer_reviews.text: These pads are awesome! I gave them as a gift and the recipient thought it was the coolest gift ever! Buy them!
customer_reviews.author: LissaLyn

customer_reviews.title: Buy these
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing pads. I've been boxing for 3 years and no regrets on these bad boys.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Ball

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality pads! Easy to adjust, light, accepts a lot of punishment.
customer_reviews.author: NCwoodsman

customer_reviews.title: Durable and great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product....have been using it on a regular basis and it's still in great shape!
customer_reviews.author: Amar

customer_reviews.title: Once you use these, you won’t want to use any other size.
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Now it will be hard to go back to holding smaller size pads.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Pads Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Great pads for folks who like to hit and kick hard. It will take some serious time to mash these babies up. Amazing stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin S. Medrala

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: Padding obsorbs. Handles break in perfectly and are comfortable. I anticipate these lasting many years of abuse
customer_reviews.author: Seth Henderson

customer_reviews.title: it was pretty stiff and hard at first but with time
customer_reviews.text: we used these for muay thai. it was pretty stiff and hard at first but with time, it has softened up with my kicks to the pads. would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The pinnacle of Muay Thai gear. Superb quality and fit and finish. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These pads offer great protection. No arm bruising from hard kicks.
customer_reviews.author: Evan E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: Good pads. They seem to be pretty sturdy. They are very firm though.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Very good quality. Dampening of kicks very good.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Fairtex by far has the best quality products
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Muay Thai pads for my husbands dojo. He absolutely loves them. Fairtex by far has the best quality products. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gomez

customer_reviews.title: WOOOO
customer_reviews.text: I love the smell of it and I'm glad I have pads as quality as this product. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good leather, good padding
customer_reviews.text: Good leather, good padding, feels natural to hold and holding up well after initial break-in period. Comes a little stiff, which is to be expected, and I'm excited to see how well it holds up after a few more months of impact.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Yek

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought these were too thick and bouncy, but no! Once I broke them in after one session, they felt perfect. These will last years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.text: They the best for a reason. High quality no comparison
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kaaihue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy. If you get approved for the Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy. If you get approved for the Amazon credit card you get an additional $50 off the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb pads
customer_reviews.text: They're Fairtex. What else really needs to be said? Top-quality leather, super-sturdy hardware and stitching, great ergos ... If you're looking for comfort and lasting quality and aren't afraid to pay for 'em, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Marcabru

customer_reviews.title: great quality. if you have a good technique you ...
customer_reviews.text: great quality . if you have a good technique you can kick these hard and it makes a big bomb clap sound. very epic 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Super thick and sturdy, good quality and comes with both Thai pads. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and lightweight, they don't dig into your forearms when holding either!
customer_reviews.author: brandy

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable - well made and light weight - best kick pads ever. Rounded nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what it looks like. Super good quality. Very durable. Chose these over the Hayabusa curved. Perfect. Shipped super fast
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Super solid pads these things are really well put together and fit well in your hands. I can see these lasting a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: isaias

customer_reviews.title: Well made...comfortable...excellent protection.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome.....I don't know why people claim it's to hard. No issues here even being very aggressive. Very good quality...easy to get used to and excellent protection.
customer_reviews.author: groomermanoz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pads!
customer_reviews.text: The curve on these is fantastic. You don't feel the normal shock through the pads when receiving kicks. On top of that, the targets make punch combos with the pads more fruitful and following with a kick it feels soft and firm at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Buy2Much

product_meta.title: Fairtex Curved MMA Muay Thai Pads (Pair)
product_meta.description: The versatility of the Fairtex Thai pads makes them an essential tool for all fight styles and disciplines. From the Manufacturer The versatility of the Fairtex Thai pads makes them an essential tool for all fight styles and disciplines.Curved design creates a tight fit and better accepts leg strikesSoft padding on the head for jabsNo sharp edges or anglesLighter than standard Thai padsLeather construction
feature_bullets: Safely train leg and knee strikes with ease with this light weight punch shield made of durable leather construction
The curved design creates a tighter fit and better accepts leg strikes making this an essential tool for all styles and disciplines in your home or commercial gym
This pair of kick pads has two forearm support straps and a reinforced riveted handle to ensure balance and stability
Protect your MMA athletes while fight training with this solid focus target curved kick pad pair
These Fairtex MMA, Muay Thai, Kickboxing standard pads are sure to aid in premium training in your martial arts classes
